panels.visual: TALL PANEL: Night around the campfire. Rahzalahn has stopped playing mid-note, her fingers frozen on the strings. She stares at Eskil with an intensity that makes the air crystallize. The firelight casts dramatic shadows across her grief-stricken face.
panels.dialogue: Rahzalahn: "I know what you are. Varangian. Your people burned my village when I was seven. They took my mother. They took my sisters."

panels.visual: Giovanni rises from his seat, ready to intervene, but Bansi catches his arm. Her gesture says 'wait - let this play out.' The others watch in tense silence around the fire.
panels.narration: The campfire had gone quiet. Giovanni rose, but Bansi caught his arm—wait, the gesture said.

panels.visual: Eskil stands motionless, his face unreadable through the helm's many holes. His voice is lower than before, rougher with old pain of his own.
panels.dialogue: Eskil: "I have done terrible things. Not to your people, but to others. I do not ask your forgiveness. I do not deserve it. But I am not your enemy. Not tonight."
